layout.name: color
layout.title: NPC's Colour
layout.tooltip: Leave blank for no effect.

layout.name: despawn
layout.title: Despawns?
layout.tooltip: If unchecked, the NPC cannot despawn. useful if you need an NPC that stays active at all times.

layout.name: initialPhase
layout.title: Initial Phase
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into. Leave empty to default to 1.

layout.name: hpflash
layout.title: Flashes when taking damage?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will display a brief hurt indicator.

layout.name: gfxwidth
layout.title: Graphical Width
layout.tooltip: The range of the NPC's image, horizontally.

layout.name: gfxheight
layout.title: Graphical Height
layout.tooltip: The range of the NPC's image, vertically.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
Set the next 2 values to 0 to make the NPC have no hitbox!
Useful if you want a background element.

layout.name: width
layout.title: Initial Hitbox Width
layout.tooltip: The range of the NPC's hitbox, horizontally.

layout.name: height
layout.title: Initial Hitbox Height
layout.tooltip: The range of the NPC's hitbox, vertically.

layout.name: gfxoffsetx
layout.title: Graphical X Offset
layout.tooltip: Offsets the hitbox from the image, horizontally. Keep it 0 if you want the hitbox to be centred.

layout.name: gfxoffsety
layout.title: Graphical Y Offset
layout.tooltip: Offsets the hitbox from the image, vertically. Keep it 0 if you want the hitbox to be centred.

layout.name: priority
layout.title: Render Priority
layout.tooltip: How close or far to the background does it appear?

layout.name: frames
layout.title: Number of frame in total
layout.tooltip: How many frames does the NPC have altogether?

layout.name: framespeed
layout.title: Framespeed
layout.tooltip: How fast does the NPC cycle through each of its frames, measured by ticks. The lower the number, the less time before it switches to the next frame.

layout.name: harmTypes
layout.title: Harm Types
layout.tooltip: A list of ways the NPC can be harmed, leave any of them unchecked to have that NPC not be affected by a certain harm type.
elements: Crushed, exploded, slid into and hit with a thrown NPC
Harmed by a held NPC by the player

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The next two settings are useful if you don't
want to set a death effect.
The NPC will handle effects itself.

layout.name: ownEffectSquish
layout.title: Handles own death effect - stomped on

layout.name: ownEffectFrameSquish
layout.title: Animation frames
layout.tooltip: How many frames will play in a loop?

layout.name: ownEffectFramespeedSquish
layout.title: Framespeed
layout.tooltip: How fast does the NPC cycle through each of its frames, measured by ticks. The lower the number, the less time before it switches to the next frame.

layout.name: ownEffectFrameOffsetSquish
layout.title: Frame offset from the first in the image
layout.tooltip: Offset from frame 0, where the animation will start?

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
NOTE: Only applies if main framestyle
is set to 'Direction Independant'

layout.name: ownEffectFrameOffsetRightSquish
layout.title: Frame offset facing right
layout.tooltip: Offset from frame 0, where the animation will start when facing right?

layout.name: ownEffectLifetime
layout.title: Lifetime of displayed effect
layout.tooltip: How many ticks until the spawned effect disappears?

layout.name: ownEffect
layout.title: Handles own death effect - any method

layout.name: ownEffectFrame
layout.title: Animation frames
layout.tooltip: How many frames will play in a loop?

layout.name: ownEffectFramespeed
layout.title: Framespeed
layout.tooltip: How fast does the NPC cycle through each of its frames, measured by ticks. The lower the number, the less time before it switches to the next frame.

layout.name: ownEffectFrameOffset
layout.title: Frame offset from the first in the image
layout.tooltip: Offset from frame 0, where the animation will start?

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
NOTE: Only applies if main framestyle
is set to 'Direction Independant'

layout.name: ownEffectFrameOffsetRight
layout.title: Frame offset facing right
layout.tooltip: Offset from frame 0, where the animation will start when facing right?

layout.name: ownEffectLifetimeAny
layout.title: Lifetime of displayed effect
layout.tooltip: How many ticks until the spawned effect disappears?

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
Important: Only type a number here when referring
to a death effect. So effect-1 would be written as 1.

layout.name: gfxoffsetEffectx
layout.title: Effect X Offset
layout.tooltip: Offsets the effect from the image, horizontally. Keep it 0 if you want it to be centred.

layout.name: gfxoffsetEffecty
layout.title: Effect Y Offset
layout.tooltip: Offsets the effect from the image, vertically. Keep it 0 if you want it to be centred.

layout.name: light
layout.title: Emits Light?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will emit light if darkness is enabled.

layout.name: lightcolor
layout.title: Light Colour
layout.tooltip: The colour of light the NPC emits in darkness.

layout.name: lightflicker
layout.title: Flickers?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the emitted light will flicker in the dark.

layout.name: cliffturn1
layout.title: Turns at cliffs?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will act like a red koopa, turning away from ledges.

layout.name: gravity1
layout.title: Affected by gravity?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will fall and be affected by gravity.

layout.name: water1
layout.title: Affected by water?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will slow down in water.

layout.name: blockCollision1
layout.title: Collides with blocks?
layout.tooltip: If not checked, the NPC will pass through all blocks, much like a Boo.

layout.name: harmless1
layout.title: Harms player?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC hurts the player when touching them.

layout.name: killThing1
layout.title: Kills player?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC kills the player when touching them.

layout.name: friendly1
layout.title: Friendly?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will be set to friendly.

layout.name: dontMove1
layout.title: Doesn't Move?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will be set to dontMove.

layout.name: npcharm1
layout.title: Harms other NPCs?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will damage hittable NPCs when touching them.

layout.name: blockharm1
layout.title: Destroys blocks?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will break fragile blocks when they are touched.

layout.name: hurtfulStomp1
layout.title: Can be stomped?
layout.tooltip: If not checked, the NPC will harm the player when stomped.

layout.name: spring1
layout.title: Acts like spring?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will bounce the player when stomped.

layout.name: springForce1
layout.title: Force of spring
layout.tooltip: The height that the NPC launches the player, if set to be a spring.

layout.name: soundInterval1
layout.title: Interval between continuous sounds?
layout.tooltip: The delay before another sound plays.

layout.name: vine1
layout.title: Acts like vine?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will act as a climbable tile.

layout.name: coin1
layout.title: Acts like coin?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will become collectable.

layout.name: coinValue1
layout.title: Award how many coins?
layout.tooltip: How many coins the NPC is worth, if the above setting is selected.

layout.name: flipped1
layout.title: Can be flipped like a galoomba?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC can flip over when stomped or hit with a tail.

layout.name: generalEffect1
layout.title: Effect to spawn every so ticks?

layout.name: generalEffectX1
layout.title: Effect X Offset
layout.tooltip: Offsets the effect from the image, horizontally. Keep it 0 if you want it to be centred.

layout.name: generalEffectY1
layout.title: Effect Y Offset
layout.tooltip: Offsets the effect from the image, vertically. Keep it 0 if you want it to be centred.

layout.name: generalEffectRandomX1
layout.title: Amount of randomness X
layout.tooltip: The minimum X value of its range.

layout.name: generalEffectRandomY1
layout.title: Amount of randomness Y
layout.tooltip: The minimum Y value of its range.

layout.name: phaseWidth1
layout.title: Hitbox Width
layout.tooltip: The range of the NPC's hitbox, horizontally.

layout.name: phaseHeight1
layout.title: Hitbox Height
layout.tooltip: The range of the NPC's hitbox, vertically.

layout.name: phaseEffectSpeed1
layout.title: Effect Speed
layout.tooltip: X and Y speed of the spawned effect.

layout.name: phaseEffectOffsetX1
layout.title: Effect X Offset
layout.tooltip: Offsets the effect from the image, horizontally. Keep it 0 if you want it to be centred.

layout.name: phaseEffectOffsetY1
layout.title: Effect Y Offset
layout.tooltip: Offsets the effect from the image, vertically. Keep it 0 if you want it to be centred.

layout.name: zero
layout.text: Set to -1 to not affect current HP

layout.name: jumpTimerPhase1
layout.title: Set jump timer to
layout.tooltip: A timer that counts up. When it reaches the set number in ticks, the NPC will jump.

layout.name: stateTimedPhase1
layout.title: Set state timer to
layout.tooltip: A timer that counts up. When it reaches the set number in ticks, the NPC can enter a new phase.

layout.name: spawnTimerPhase1
layout.title: Set spawn timer to
layout.tooltip: A timer that counts up. When it reaches the set number in ticks, it will spawn the NPC.

layout.name: meleeTimerPhase1
layout.title: Set melee timer to
layout.tooltip: A timer that counts up. When it reaches the set number in ticks, it will attack with its melee hitbox.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
Stuff relating to Trailing NPCs.
Leave the first setting at 0 for no effect.

layout.name: trailNPCCount1
layout.title:
Number + ID of NPCs to spawn?
Separate each entry with a comma.

layout.name: trailX1
layout.title:
Distance, Diameter Offset, X Offset
Separate each entry with a comma.

layout.name: trailY1
layout.title:
Rotation Speed, Y Offset
Separate each entry with a comma.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
Waypoint related, leave the below setting
blank to ignore this chunk of settings.
If you want to display a specific animation when warping to a waypoint, use the fall animation settings.

layout.name: waypointXY1
layout.title: Offset from spawned point
layout.tooltip: Offset the waypoint from its current position. This runs AFTER the NPC has reached it.

layout.name: waypointExactXY1
layout.title: Exact Coords to go to (leave at 0 to ignore)

layout.name: waypointStateTimer1
layout.title:
Allow state timer to
continue counting up?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC's state timer (the one that counts up every tick) will NOT be paused while the waypoint behaviour is running. Useful if you want to move the waypoint a bunch of places and have it end when the state timer reaches a desired integer.

layout.name: waypointTeleport1
layout.title: Move by teleporting?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will warp to the waypoint in a similar manner to a magikoopa.

layout.name: altAnimationTimer1
layout.title: Animation timer controlled by state timer?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC's state timer (the one that counts up every tick) will control the animation of the NPC, instead of the general timer usually used for animation.

layout.name: maxHP1
layout.title: HP
layout.tooltip: The HP of the NPC in its first phase. If HP is set to 0, the NPC cannot die.

layout.name: hpdamagefire1
layout.title: Damage from fireballs
layout.tooltip: The amount of damage the NPC takes when hit by a fireball.

layout.name: hpdamagefireSFX1
layout.title: Sound effect when hit by fireball

layout.name: hpdamage1
layout.title: Damage from anything else
layout.tooltip: The amount of damage the NPC takes when hit otherwise.

layout.name: hpdamageSFX1
layout.title: Sound effect when hit by anything else

layout.name: paralyse1
layout.title: Paralysed from jumps?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will stop moving when jumped on.

layout.name: paralyseAnything1
layout.title: Paralysed from anything?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will stop moving when attacked

layout.name: knockback1
layout.title: Player knockback from jumps
layout.tooltip: How far the player is launched when jumping on the NPC.

layout.name: rotationSpeed1
layout.title: Rotation Speed
layout.tooltip: The speed in which the NPC rotates. Recommended to set it the same as its current speed.

layout.name: speedAdjust1
layout.title:
Adjust current speed based on
previous state's speed?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will gradually change its current speed based on the speed from the last state.

layout.name: shake1
layout.title: Shakes?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will shake as if it's been harmed.

layout.name: redirector1
layout.title: Moves with redirectors?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will react to redirectors. They can change its movement speed. Speed is determined by horizontal movement speed.

layout.name: lineGuide1
layout.title: Moves with line guides?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will follow line guides. Speed is determined by horizontal movement speed.

layout.name: generalTimerX1
layout.title: General Timer (hover over me!)
layout.tooltip:
Controls a multitude of things relating to the above setting.
It affects the time it stays still when wandering, the slipperiness of it when chasing, the time before it turns around if set as a SMW enemy and how far it moves before changing speed if set to be a hammer bro. Alongside this, it also affects the jumping delay for the 'Zelda 2 Bot' general movement option.
Keep at -1 to not have this come into play.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The next three options must have
The next checkbox be ticked.

layout.name: horizAmplitude1
layout.title: Horizontal Sine Amplitude
layout.tooltip: Adjusts how far the NPC moves, before turning. <u>Recommended to keep roughly between 1 and 150.</u>

layout.name: generalTimerY1
layout.title: General Timer (hover over me!)
layout.tooltip:
Controls a multitude of things relating to the above setting.
It affects the slipperiness of it when chasing and the time before it turns around if set as a SMW enemy.
Keep at -1 to not have this come into play.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The next three options must have
The next checkbox be ticked.

layout.name: vertiAmplitude1
layout.title: Vertical Sine Amplitude
layout.tooltip: Adjusts how far the NPC moves, before turning. <u>Recommended to keep roughly between 1 and 150.</u>

layout.name: zero
layout.text: Set the below setting to -1 to have it not jump.

layout.name: jumpTimer1
layout.title: Jump Timer
layout.tooltip: A timer that counts up. When it reaches the set number in ticks, the NPC will jump.

layout.name: jumpHeight1
layout.title: Jump Height
layout.tooltip: Jumping height of the NPC.

layout.name: jumpAir1
layout.title: Can jump in air?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC doesn't need to be touching the ground in order to jump.

layout.name: playerJump1
layout.title: Jumps when player jumps?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will jump when the player does.

layout.name: paragoombaJump1
layout.title: Jumps like a paragoomba?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will jump twice, then perform a jump based on the other settings.

layout.name: stun1
layout.title: Stun player when landing?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will stun the player when landing, if they are on the ground.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
Define spawn settings in the
Spawning Settings category.

layout.name: jumpSpawn1
layout.title: Can spawn NPCs when jumping?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC spawns another when jumping. Must be defined below.

layout.name: zero
layout.text: Set the below setting to -1 to have it not spawn anything.

layout.name: spawnTimer1
layout.title: Spawn Timer
layout.tooltip: A timer that counts up. When it reaches the set number in ticks, it will spawn the NPC.

layout.name: spawnedNPC1
layout.title: NPC to spawn
layout.tooltip: Optional NPC to spawn. Leave blank to not spawn anything.

layout.name: burst1
layout.title: Number of shots
layout.tooltip: Fires NPCs in a burst.

layout.name: alterX1
layout.title: Alter x-position by how much
layout.tooltip: Bigger numbers give more intense effects.

layout.name: alterY1
layout.title: Alter y-position by how much
layout.tooltip: Bigger numbers give more intense effects.

layout.name: spawnX1
layout.title: Spawn X Offset
layout.tooltip: X offset to spawn, offset from the NPC's centre.

layout.name: spawnY1
layout.title: Spawn Y Offset
layout.tooltip: Y offset to spawn, offset from the NPC's centre.

layout.name: targetX1
layout.title: Targets player's X-coords?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will target the player on the X-axis.

layout.name: targetY1
layout.title: Targets player's Y-coords?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will target the player on the Y-axis.

layout.name: spawnSpeedX1
layout.title: Spawn Speed X
layout.tooltip: X speed of the spawned NPC.

layout.name: spawnSpeedY1
layout.title: Spawn Speed Y
layout.tooltip: Y speed of the spawned NPC.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The below setting lets the other two become available.
The number input determines the minimum range
of speed it can start from. So if you have its X speed
set at 5, and put the amount of randomness at 2,
it will choose a speed between 2 and 5. -5 will make it
have a range between -5 and 5, so in front and behind.

layout.name: randomCheck1
layout.title: Random Movement?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the below settings will become available.

layout.name: randomSpeedX1
layout.title: Amount of randomness X
layout.tooltip: The minimum X value of its range, in terms of speed.

layout.name: randomSpeedY1
layout.title: Amount of randomness Y
layout.tooltip: The minimum Y value of its range, in terms of speed.

layout.name: spawnAI1
layout.title:
NPC's AI fields
(each number represents ai1-ai6)

layout.name: deathParent1
layout.title:
Dies when parent dies?
(Or changes states)

layout.name: meleeTimer1
layout.title: Timer before attacking
layout.tooltip: A timer that counts up. When it reaches the set number in ticks, it will attack with its melee hitbox.

layout.name: meleeX1
layout.title: X offset of the hitbox
layout.tooltip: The X offset from the centre of the NPC.

layout.name: meleeY1
layout.title: Y offset of the hitbox
layout.tooltip: The Y offset from the centre of the NPC.

layout.name: meleeTime1
layout.title: Attack duration
layout.tooltip: The time in ticks that the NPC attacks for. Each second is 64 ticks.

layout.name: meleePlayer1
layout.title: Harms players?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the hitbox will be dangerous to players.

layout.name: meleeNPC1
layout.title: Harms NPCs?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the hitbox will be deadly to most hittable NPCs.

layout.name: meleeBlock1
layout.title: Breaks Blocks?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the hitbox will be devastating to fragile blocks.

layout.name: meleeSpeed1
layout.title: Set speed to 0?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will stop to attack.

layout.name: meleePhase1
layout.title:
Change phase when a player
enters the hitbox.

layout.name: meleeDebug1
layout.title: Display visual of hitbox?
layout.tooltip: Set this to see where the hitbox will be. Recommended for debugging purposes.

Set the below settings to -1 to not transform.
This is an internal timer that counts up, and when it
hits the set number it will transform.
Additionally, you can use an event to transform as well.

layout.tooltip:

new phase that the NPC can transform into. Only works if the above value is not set to 0.

layout.name: cliffturn2
layout.title: Turns at cliffs?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will act like a red koopa, turning away from ledges.

layout.name: gravity2
layout.title: Affected by gravity?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will fall and be affected by gravity.

layout.name: water2
layout.title: Affected by water?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will slow down in water.

layout.name: blockCollision2
layout.title: Collides with blocks?
layout.tooltip: If not checked, the NPC will pass through all blocks, much like a Boo.

layout.name: harmless2
layout.title: Harms player?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC hurts the player when touching them.

layout.name: killThing2
layout.title: Kills player?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC kills the player when touching them.

layout.name: friendly2

layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will be set to friendly.

layout.name: dontMove2
layout.title: Doesn't Move?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will be set to dontMove.

layout.name: npcharm2

layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will damage hittable NPCs when touching them.

layout.name: blockharm2
layout.title: Destroys blocks?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will break fragile blocks when they are touched.

layout.name: hurtfulStomp2

layout.tooltip: If not checked, the NPC will harm the player when stomped.

layout.name: spring2
layout.title: Acts like spring?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will bounce the player when stomped.

layout.name: springForce2
layout.title: Force of spring
layout.tooltip: The height that the NPC launches the player, if set to be a spring.

layout.name: soundInterval2
layout.title: Interval between continuous sounds?
layout.tooltip: The delay before another sound plays.

layout.name: vine2

layout.name: coin2

layout.name: coinValue2

layout.tooltip: How many coins the NPC is worth, if the above setting is selected.

layout.name: flipped2

layout.name: waypointStateTimer2
layout.title:
Allow state timer to
continue counting up?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC's state timer (the one that counts up every tick) will NOT be paused while the waypoint behaviour is running. Useful if you want to move the waypoint a bunch of places and have it end when the state timer reaches a desired integer.

layout.name: waypointTeleport2
layout.title: Move by teleporting?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will warp to the waypoint in a similar manner to a magikoopa.

layout.name: altAnimationTimer2
layout.title: Animation timer controlled by state timer?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC's state timer (the one that counts up every tick) will control the animation of the NPC, instead of the general timer usually used for animation.

layout.name: maxHP2

layout.tooltip: The HP of the NPC in its first phase. If HP is set to 0, the NPC cannot die.

layout.tooltip: The amount of damage the NPC takes when hit by a fireball.

layout.title: Sound effect when hit by fireball

layout.title: Damage from anything else
layout.tooltip: The amount of damage the NPC takes when hit otherwise.

layout.name: hpdamageSFX2
layout.title: Sound effect when hit by anything else

layout.title: Paralysed from jumps?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will stop moving when jumped on.

layout.title: Paralysed from anything?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will stop moving when attacked

layout.name: knockback2
layout.title: Player knockback from jumps
layout.tooltip: How far the player is launched when jumping on the NPC.

layout.name: rotationSpeed2
layout.title: Rotation Speed
layout.tooltip: The speed in which the NPC rotates. Recommended to set it the same as its current speed.

layout.name: speedAdjust2
layout.title:
Adjust current speed based on
previous state's speed?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will gradually change its current speed based on the speed from the last state.

layout.name: shake2
layout.title: Shakes?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will shake as if it's been harmed.

layout.name: redirector2
layout.title: Moves with redirectors?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will react to redirectors. They can change its movement speed. Speed is determined by horizontal movement speed.

layout.name: lineGuide2
layout.title: Moves with line guides?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will follow line guides. Speed is determined by horizontal movement speed.

layout.name: generalTimerX2
layout.title: General Timer (hover over me!)
layout.tooltip:
Controls a multitude of things relating to the above setting.
It affects the time it stays still when wandering, the slipperiness of it when chasing, the time before it turns around if set as a SMW enemy and how far it moves before changing speed if set to be a hammer bro. Alongside this, it also affects the jumping delay for the 'Zelda 2 Bot' general movement option.
Keep at -1 to not have this come into play.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The next three options must have
The next checkbox be ticked.

layout.name: horizAmplitude2
layout.title: Horizontal Sine Amplitude
layout.tooltip: Adjusts how far the NPC moves, before turning. <u>Recommended to keep roughly between 1 and 150.</u>

layout.name: generalTimerY2
layout.title: General Timer (hover over me!)
layout.tooltip:
Controls a multitude of things relating to the above setting.
It affects the slipperiness of it when chasing and the time before it turns around if set as a SMW enemy.
Keep at -1 to not have this come into play.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The next three options must have
The next checkbox be ticked.

layout.name: vertiAmplitude2
layout.title: Vertical Sine Amplitude
layout.tooltip: Adjusts how far the NPC moves, before turning. <u>Recommended to keep roughly between 1 and 150.</u>

layout.tooltip: Jumping height of the NPC.

layout.name: jumpAir2
layout.title: Can jump in air?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC doesn't need to be touching the ground in order to jump.

layout.name: playerJump2
layout.title: Jumps when player jumps?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will jump when the player does.

layout.name: paragoombaJump2
layout.title: Jumps like a paragoomba?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will jump twice, then perform a jump based on the other settings.

layout.name: stun2
layout.title: Stun player when landing?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will stun the player when landing, if they are on the ground.

layout.name: zero

layout.name: spawnTimer2
layout.title: Spawn Timer
layout.tooltip: A timer that counts up. When it reaches the set number in ticks, it will spawn the NPC.

layout.name: burst2
layout.title: Number of shots
layout.tooltip: Fires NPCs in a burst.

layout.name: alterX2
layout.title: Alter x-position by how much
layout.tooltip: Bigger numbers give more intense effects.

layout.name: alterY2
layout.title: Alter y-position by how much
layout.tooltip: Bigger numbers give more intense effects.

layout.title: Spawn X Offset
layout.tooltip: X offset to spawn, offset from the NPC's centre.

layout.name: spawnY2
layout.title: Spawn Y Offset
layout.tooltip: Y offset to spawn, offset from the NPC's centre.

layout.title: Targets player's X-coords?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will target the player on the X-axis.

layout.name: targetY2
layout.title: Targets player's Y-coords?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will target the player on the Y-axis.

layout.title: Spawn Speed X
layout.tooltip: X speed of the spawned NPC.

layout.name: spawnSpeedY2
layout.title: Spawn Speed Y
layout.tooltip: Y speed of the spawned NPC.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The below setting lets the other two become available.
The number input determines the minimum range
of speed it can start from. So if you have its X speed
set at 5, and put the amount of randomness at 2,
it will choose a speed between 2 and 5. -5 will make it
have a range between -5 and 5, so in front and behind.

layout.name: randomCheck2
layout.title: Random Movement?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the below settings will become available.

layout.title:
Adjust current speed based on
previous state's speed?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will gradually change its current speed based on the speed from the last state.

layout.name: shake3
layout.title: Shakes?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will shake as if it's been harmed.

layout.name: redirector3
layout.title: Moves with redirectors?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will react to redirectors. They can change its movement speed. Speed is determined by horizontal movement speed.

layout.name: lineGuide3
layout.title: Moves with line guides?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will follow line guides. Speed is determined by horizontal movement speed.

layout.name: generalTimerX3
layout.title: General Timer (hover over me!)
layout.tooltip:
Controls a multitude of things relating to the above setting.
It affects the time it stays still when wandering, the slipperiness of it when chasing, the time before it turns around if set as a SMW enemy and how far it moves before changing speed if set to be a hammer bro. Alongside this, it also affects the jumping delay for the 'Zelda 2 Bot' general movement option.
Keep at -1 to not have this come into play.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The next three options must have
The next checkbox be ticked.

layout.name: horizAmplitude3
layout.title: Horizontal Sine Amplitude
layout.tooltip: Adjusts how far the NPC moves, before turning. <u>Recommended to keep roughly between 1 and 150.</u>

layout.name: generalTimerY3
layout.title: General Timer (hover over me!)
layout.tooltip:
Controls a multitude of things relating to the above setting.
It affects the slipperiness of it when chasing and the time before it turns around if set as a SMW enemy.
Keep at -1 to not have this come into play.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The next three options must have
The next checkbox be ticked.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The below setting lets the other two become available.
The number input determines the minimum range
of speed it can start from. So if you have its X speed
set at 5, and put the amount of randomness at 2,
it will choose a speed between 2 and 5. -5 will make it
have a range between -5 and 5, so in front and behind.

layout.name: maxHP4
layout.title: HP
layout.tooltip: The HP of the NPC in its first phase. If HP is set to 0, the NPC cannot die.

layout.name: hpdamagefire4
layout.title: Damage from fireballs
layout.tooltip: The amount of damage the NPC takes when hit by a fireball.

layout.name: hpdamagefireSFX4
layout.title: Sound effect when hit by fireball

layout.name: hpdamage4
layout.title: Damage from anything else
layout.tooltip: The amount of damage the NPC takes when hit otherwise.

layout.name: hpdamageSFX4
layout.title: Sound effect when hit by anything else

layout.name: paralyse4
layout.title: Paralysed from jumps?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will stop moving when jumped on.

layout.name: paralyseAnything4
layout.title: Paralysed from anything?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will stop moving when attacked

layout.name: knockback4
layout.title: Player knockback from jumps
layout.tooltip: How far the player is launched when jumping on the NPC.

layout.name: rotationSpeed4
layout.title: Rotation Speed
layout.tooltip: The speed in which the NPC rotates. Recommended to set it the same as its current speed.

layout.name: speedAdjust4
layout.title:
Adjust current speed based on
previous state's speed?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will gradually change its current speed based on the speed from the last state.

layout.name: shake4
layout.title: Shakes?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will shake as if it's been harmed.

layout.name: redirector4
layout.title: Moves with redirectors?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will react to redirectors. They can change its movement speed. Speed is determined by horizontal movement speed.

layout.name: lineGuide4
layout.title: Moves with line guides?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will follow line guides. Speed is determined by horizontal movement speed.

layout.name: generalTimerX4
layout.title: General Timer (hover over me!)
layout.tooltip:
Controls a multitude of things relating to the above setting.
It affects the time it stays still when wandering, the slipperiness of it when chasing, the time before it turns around if set as a SMW enemy and how far it moves before changing speed if set to be a hammer bro. Alongside this, it also affects the jumping delay for the 'Zelda 2 Bot' general movement option.
Keep at -1 to not have this come into play.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The next three options must have
The next checkbox be ticked.

layout.name: horizAmplitude4
layout.title: Horizontal Sine Amplitude
layout.tooltip: Adjusts how far the NPC moves, before turning. <u>Recommended to keep roughly between 1 and 150.</u>

layout.name: generalTimerY4
layout.title: General Timer (hover over me!)
layout.tooltip:
Controls a multitude of things relating to the above setting.
It affects the slipperiness of it when chasing and the time before it turns around if set as a SMW enemy.
Keep at -1 to not have this come into play.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The next three options must have
The next checkbox be ticked.

layout.name: vertiAmplitude4
layout.title: Vertical Sine Amplitude
layout.tooltip: Adjusts how far the NPC moves, before turning. <u>Recommended to keep roughly between 1 and 150.</u>

layout.name: zero
layout.text: Set the below setting to -1 to have it not jump.

layout.name: jumpTimer4
layout.title: Jump Timer
layout.tooltip: A timer that counts up. When it reaches the set number in ticks, the NPC will jump.

layout.name: jumpHeight4
layout.title: Jump Height
layout.tooltip: Jumping height of the NPC.

layout.name: jumpAir4
layout.title: Can jump in air?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC doesn't need to be touching the ground in order to jump.

layout.name: playerJump4
layout.title: Jumps when player jumps?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will jump when the player does.

layout.name: paragoombaJump4
layout.title: Jumps like a paragoomba?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will jump twice, then perform a jump based on the other settings.

layout.name: stun4
layout.title: Stun player when landing?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will stun the player when landing, if they are on the ground.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
Define spawn settings in the
Spawning Settings category.

layout.name: jumpSpawn4
layout.title: Can spawn NPCs when jumping?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC spawns another when jumping. Must be defined below.

layout.name: zero
layout.text: Set the below setting to -1 to have it not spawn anything.

layout.name: spawnTimer4
layout.title: Spawn Timer
layout.tooltip: A timer that counts up. When it reaches the set number in ticks, it will spawn the NPC.

layout.name: spawnedNPC4
layout.title: NPC to spawn
layout.tooltip: Optional NPC to spawn. Leave blank to not spawn anything.

layout.name: burst4
layout.title: Number of shots
layout.tooltip: Fires NPCs in a burst.

layout.name: alterX4
layout.title: Alter x-position by how much
layout.tooltip: Bigger numbers give more intense effects.

layout.name: alterY4
layout.title: Alter y-position by how much
layout.tooltip: Bigger numbers give more intense effects.

layout.name: spawnX4
layout.title: Spawn X Offset
layout.tooltip: X offset to spawn, offset from the NPC's centre.

layout.name: spawnY4
layout.title: Spawn Y Offset
layout.tooltip: Y offset to spawn, offset from the NPC's centre.

layout.name: targetX4
layout.title: Targets player's X-coords?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will target the player on the X-axis.

layout.name: targetY4
layout.title: Targets player's Y-coords?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will target the player on the Y-axis.

layout.name: spawnSpeedX4
layout.title: Spawn Speed X
layout.tooltip: X speed of the spawned NPC.

layout.name: spawnSpeedY4
layout.title: Spawn Speed Y
layout.tooltip: Y speed of the spawned NPC.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The below setting lets the other two become available.
The number input determines the minimum range
of speed it can start from. So if you have its X speed
set at 5, and put the amount of randomness at 2,
it will choose a speed between 2 and 5. -5 will make it
have a range between -5 and 5, so in front and behind.

layout.name: randomCheck4
layout.title: Random Movement?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the below settings will become available.

layout.name: randomSpeedX4
layout.title: Amount of randomness X
layout.tooltip: The minimum X value of its range, in terms of speed.

layout.name: randomSpeedY4
layout.title: Amount of randomness Y
layout.tooltip: The minimum Y value of its range, in terms of speed.

layout.name: spawnAI4
layout.title:
NPC's AI fields
(each number represents ai1-ai6)

layout.name: deathParent4
layout.title:
Dies when parent dies?
(Or changes states)

layout.tooltip: A timer that counts up. When it reaches the set number in ticks, it will attack with its melee hitbox.

layout.tooltip: The X offset from the centre of the NPC.

layout.name: meleeY4
layout.title: Y offset of the hitbox
layout.tooltip: The Y offset from the centre of the NPC.

layout.name: meleeTime4

layout.tooltip: The time in ticks that the NPC attacks for. Each second is 64 ticks.

layout.name: meleePlayer4
layout.title: Harms players?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the hitbox will be dangerous to players.

layout.name: meleeNPC4

layout.tooltip: If checked, the hitbox will be deadly to most hittable NPCs.

layout.name: meleeBlock4
layout.title: Breaks Blocks?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the hitbox will be devastating to fragile blocks.

layout.name: meleeSpeed4
layout.title: Set speed to 0?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will stop to attack.

Change phase when a player
enters the hitbox.

layout.name: meleeDebug4
layout.title: Display visual of hitbox?
layout.tooltip: Set this to see where the hitbox will be. Recommended for debugging purposes.

layout.tooltip: How fast does the NPC cycle through each of its frames, measured by ticks. The lower the number, the less time before it switches to the next frame.

layout.title: Frame offset from the first in the image
layout.tooltip: Offset from frame 0, where the animation will start?

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
NOTE: Only applies if main framestyle
is set to 'Direction Independant'

layout.name: frameoffsetMeleeRight5
layout.title: Frame offset facing right
layout.tooltip: Offset from frame 0, where the animation will start when facing right?

layout.name: maxHP5
layout.title: HP
layout.tooltip: The HP of the NPC in its first phase. If HP is set to 0, the NPC cannot die.

layout.name: hpdamagefire5
layout.title: Damage from fireballs
layout.tooltip: The amount of damage the NPC takes when hit by a fireball.

layout.name: hpdamagefireSFX5
layout.title: Sound effect when hit by fireball

layout.name: hpdamage5
layout.title: Damage from anything else
layout.tooltip: The amount of damage the NPC takes when hit otherwise.

layout.name: hpdamageSFX5
layout.title: Sound effect when hit by anything else

layout.name: paralyse5
layout.title: Paralysed from jumps?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will stop moving when jumped on.

layout.name: paralyseAnything5
layout.title: Paralysed from anything?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will stop moving when attacked

layout.name: knockback5
layout.title: Player knockback from jumps
layout.tooltip: How far the player is launched when jumping on the NPC.

layout.name: rotationSpeed5
layout.title: Rotation Speed
layout.tooltip: The speed in which the NPC rotates. Recommended to set it the same as its current speed.

layout.name: speedAdjust5
layout.title:
Adjust current speed based on
previous state's speed?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will gradually change its current speed based on the speed from the last state.

layout.name: shake5
layout.title: Shakes?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will shake as if it's been harmed.

layout.name: redirector5
layout.title: Moves with redirectors?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will react to redirectors. They can change its movement speed. Speed is determined by horizontal movement speed.

layout.name: lineGuide5
layout.title: Moves with line guides?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will follow line guides. Speed is determined by horizontal movement speed.

layout.name: generalTimerX5
layout.title: General Timer (hover over me!)
layout.tooltip:
Controls a multitude of things relating to the above setting.
It affects the time it stays still when wandering, the slipperiness of it when chasing, the time before it turns around if set as a SMW enemy and how far it moves before changing speed if set to be a hammer bro. Alongside this, it also affects the jumping delay for the 'Zelda 2 Bot' general movement option.
Keep at -1 to not have this come into play.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The next three options must have
The next checkbox be ticked.

layout.name: horizAmplitude5
layout.title: Horizontal Sine Amplitude
layout.tooltip: Adjusts how far the NPC moves, before turning. <u>Recommended to keep roughly between 1 and 150.</u>

layout.name: generalTimerY5
layout.title: General Timer (hover over me!)
layout.tooltip:
Controls a multitude of things relating to the above setting.
It affects the slipperiness of it when chasing and the time before it turns around if set as a SMW enemy.
Keep at -1 to not have this come into play.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The next three options must have
The next checkbox be ticked.

layout.name: vertiAmplitude5
layout.title: Vertical Sine Amplitude

layout.name: zero
layout.text: Set the below setting to -1 to have it not jump.

layout.name: jumpTimer5
layout.title: Jump Timer
layout.tooltip: A timer that counts up. When it reaches the set number in ticks, the NPC will jump.

layout.name: jumpHeight5
layout.title: Jump Height
layout.tooltip: Jumping height of the NPC.

layout.name: jumpAir5
layout.title: Can jump in air?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC doesn't need to be touching the ground in order to jump.

layout.name: playerJump5
layout.title: Jumps when player jumps?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will jump when the player does.

layout.name: paragoombaJump5
layout.title: Jumps like a paragoomba?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will jump twice, then perform a jump based on the other settings.

layout.name: stun5
layout.title: Stun player when landing?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will stun the player when landing, if they are on the ground.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
Define spawn settings in the
Spawning Settings category.

layout.name: jumpSpawn5
layout.title: Can spawn NPCs when jumping?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC spawns another when jumping. Must be defined below.

layout.name: zero
layout.text: Set the below setting to -1 to have it not spawn anything.

layout.name: spawnTimer5
layout.title: Spawn Timer
layout.tooltip: A timer that counts up. When it reaches the set number in ticks, it will spawn the NPC.

layout.name: spawnedNPC5
layout.title: NPC to spawn
layout.tooltip: Optional NPC to spawn. Leave blank to not spawn anything.

layout.name: spawnX5
layout.title: Spawn X Offset
layout.tooltip: X offset to spawn, offset from the NPC's centre.

layout.name: burst5
layout.title: Number of shots
layout.tooltip: Fires NPCs in a burst.

layout.name: alterX5
layout.title: Alter x-position by how much
layout.tooltip: Bigger numbers give more intense effects.

layout.name: alterY5
layout.title: Alter y-position by how much
layout.tooltip: Bigger numbers give more intense effects.

layout.name: spawnY5
layout.title: Spawn Y Offset
layout.tooltip: Y offset to spawn, offset from the NPC's centre.

layout.name: targetX5
layout.title: Targets player's X-coords?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will target the player on the X-axis.

layout.name: targetY5
layout.title: Targets player's Y-coords?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will target the player on the Y-axis.

layout.name: spawnSpeedX5
layout.title: Spawn Speed X
layout.tooltip: X speed of the spawned NPC.

layout.name: spawnSpeedY5
layout.title: Spawn Speed Y
layout.tooltip: Y speed of the spawned NPC.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The below setting lets the other two become available.
The number input determines the minimum range
of speed it can start from. So if you have its X speed
set at 5, and put the amount of randomness at 2,
it will choose a speed between 2 and 5. -5 will make it
have a range between -5 and 5, so in front and behind.

layout.name: randomCheck5
layout.title: Random Movement?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the below settings will become available.

layout.name: randomSpeedX5
layout.title: Amount of randomness X
layout.tooltip: The minimum X value of its range, in terms of speed.

layout.name: randomSpeedY5
layout.title: Amount of randomness Y
layout.tooltip: The minimum Y value of its range, in terms of speed.

NPC's AI fields

layout.name: meleeY5

layout.name: meleeBlock5

layout.name: jumpAir6
layout.title: Can jump in air?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC doesn't need to be touching the ground in order to jump.

layout.name: playerJump6
layout.title: Jumps when player jumps?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will jump when the player does.

layout.name: paragoombaJump6

layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will jump twice, then perform a jump based on the other settings.

layout.name: stun6

Spawning Settings category.

layout.name: zero
layout.text: Set the below setting to -1 to have it not spawn anything.

layout.name: spawnTimer6
layout.title: Spawn Timer
layout.tooltip: A timer that counts up. When it reaches the set number in ticks, it will spawn the NPC.

layout.name: spawnedNPC6
layout.title: NPC to spawn
layout.tooltip: Optional NPC to spawn. Leave blank to not spawn anything.

layout.name: spawnX6
layout.title: Spawn X Offset
layout.tooltip: X offset to spawn, offset from the NPC's centre.

layout.name: burst6
layout.title: Number of shots
layout.tooltip: Fires NPCs in a burst.

layout.name: alterX6
layout.title: Alter x-position by how much
layout.tooltip: Bigger numbers give more intense effects.

layout.name: alterY6
layout.title: Alter y-position by how much
layout.tooltip: Bigger numbers give more intense effects.

layout.name: spawnY6
layout.title: Spawn Y Offset
layout.tooltip: Y offset to spawn, offset from the NPC's centre.

layout.name: targetX6
layout.title: Targets player's X-coords?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will target the player on the X-axis.

layout.name: targetY6
layout.title: Targets player's Y-coords?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will target the player on the Y-axis.

layout.name: spawnSpeedX6
layout.title: Spawn Speed X
layout.tooltip: X speed of the spawned NPC.

layout.name: spawnSpeedY6
layout.title: Spawn Speed Y
layout.tooltip: Y speed of the spawned NPC.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The below setting lets the other two become available.
The number input determines the minimum range
of speed it can start from. So if you have its X speed
set at 5, and put the amount of randomness at 2,
it will choose a speed between 2 and 5. -5 will make it
have a range between -5 and 5, so in front and behind.

layout.name: randomSpeedY6
layout.title: Amount of randomness Y

Alongside this, it also affects the jumping delay for the 'Zelda 2 Bot' general movement option.
Keep at -1 to not have this come into play.

continue counting up?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC's state timer (the one that counts up every tick) will NOT be paused while the waypoint behaviour is running. Useful if you want to move the waypoint a bunch of places and have it end when the state timer reaches a desired integer.

layout.name: waypointTeleport8
layout.title: Move by teleporting?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will warp to the waypoint in a similar manner to a magikoopa.

layout.name: speedAdjust8
layout.title:
Adjust current speed based on
previous state's speed?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will gradually change its current speed based on the speed from the last state.

layout.name: shake8
layout.title: Shakes?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will shake as if it's been harmed.

layout.name: redirector8
layout.title: Moves with redirectors?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will react to redirectors. They can change its movement speed. Speed is determined by horizontal movement speed.

layout.name: lineGuide8
layout.title: Moves with line guides?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will follow line guides. Speed is determined by horizontal movement speed.

layout.name: generalTimerX8
layout.title: General Timer (hover over me!)
layout.tooltip:
Controls a multitude of things relating to the above setting.
It affects the time it stays still when wandering, the slipperiness of it when chasing, the time before it turns around if set as a SMW enemy and how far it moves before changing speed if set to be a hammer bro. Alongside this, it also affects the jumping delay for the 'Zelda 2 Bot' general movement option.
Keep at -1 to not have this come into play.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The next three options must have
The next checkbox be ticked.

layout.name: horizAmplitude8
layout.title: Horizontal Sine Amplitude
layout.tooltip: Adjusts how far the NPC moves, before turning. <u>Recommended to keep roughly between 1 and 150.</u>

layout.name: generalTimerY8
layout.title: General Timer (hover over me!)
layout.tooltip:
Controls a multitude of things relating to the above setting.
It affects the slipperiness of it when chasing and the time before it turns around if set as a SMW enemy.
Keep at -1 to not have this come into play.

layout.name: flipped9

layout.name: waypointStateTimer9
layout.title:
Allow state timer to
continue counting up?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC's state timer (the one that counts up every tick) will NOT be paused while the waypoint behaviour is running. Useful if you want to move the waypoint a bunch of places and have it end when the state timer reaches a desired integer.

layout.name: waypointTeleport9
layout.title: Move by teleporting?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will warp to the waypoint in a similar manner to a magikoopa.

layout.name: altAnimationTimer9

layout.name: maxHP9

layout.tooltip: The HP of the NPC in its first phase. If HP is set to 0, the NPC cannot die.

layout.title: Damage from fireballs
layout.tooltip: The amount of damage the NPC takes when hit by a fireball.

layout.name: hpdamagefireSFX9
layout.title: Sound effect when hit by fireball

layout.name: hpdamage9
layout.title: Damage from anything else
layout.tooltip: The amount of damage the NPC takes when hit otherwise.

layout.name: hpdamageSFX9

layout.name: paralyse9
layout.title: Paralysed from jumps?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will stop moving when jumped on.

layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will stop moving when attacked

layout.name: knockback9
layout.title: Player knockback from jumps
layout.tooltip: How far the player is launched when jumping on the NPC.

layout.name: rotationSpeed9
layout.title: Rotation Speed
layout.tooltip: The speed in which the NPC rotates. Recommended to set it the same as its current speed.

layout.name: speedAdjust9
layout.title:
Adjust current speed based on
previous state's speed?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will gradually change its current speed based on the speed from the last state.

layout.name: shake9
layout.title: Shakes?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will shake as if it's been harmed.

layout.name: redirector9
layout.title: Moves with redirectors?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will react to redirectors. They can change its movement speed. Speed is determined by horizontal movement speed.

layout.name: lineGuide9
layout.title: Moves with line guides?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will follow line guides. Speed is determined by horizontal movement speed.

layout.name: generalTimerX9
layout.title: General Timer (hover over me!)
layout.tooltip:
Controls a multitude of things relating to the above setting.
It affects the time it stays still when wandering, the slipperiness of it when chasing, the time before it turns around if set as a SMW enemy and how far it moves before changing speed if set to be a hammer bro. Alongside this, it also affects the jumping delay for the 'Zelda 2 Bot' general movement option.
Keep at -1 to not have this come into play.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The next three options must have
The next checkbox be ticked.

layout.name: horizAmplitude9
layout.title: Horizontal Sine Amplitude
layout.tooltip: Adjusts how far the NPC moves, before turning. <u>Recommended to keep roughly between 1 and 150.</u>

layout.name: generalTimerY9
layout.title: General Timer (hover over me!)
layout.tooltip:
Controls a multitude of things relating to the above setting.
It affects the slipperiness of it when chasing and the time before it turns around if set as a SMW enemy.
Keep at -1 to not have this come into play.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The next three options must have
The next checkbox be ticked.

layout.name: vertiAmplitude9
layout.title: Vertical Sine Amplitude
layout.tooltip: Adjusts how far the NPC moves, before turning. <u>Recommended to keep roughly between 1 and 150.</u>

layout.tooltip: Jumping height of the NPC.

layout.name: jumpAir9
layout.title: Can jump in air?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC doesn't need to be touching the ground in order to jump.

layout.name: playerJump9
layout.title: Jumps when player jumps?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will jump when the player does.

layout.name: paragoombaJump9
layout.title: Jumps like a paragoomba?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will jump twice, then perform a jump based on the other settings.

layout.name: stun9
layout.title: Stun player when landing?

layout.name: targetY9

layout.name: spawnSpeedY9

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The below setting lets the other two become available.
The number input determines the minimum range
of speed it can start from. So if you have its X speed
set at 5, and put the amount of randomness at 2,
it will choose a speed between 2 and 5. -5 will make it
have a range between -5 and 5, so in front and behind.

layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will damage hittable NPCs when touching them.

layout.name: blockharm10
layout.title: Destroys blocks?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will break fragile blocks when they are touched.

layout.name: hurtfulStomp10
layout.title: Can be stomped?
layout.tooltip: If not checked, the NPC will harm the player when stomped.

layout.name: spring10
layout.title: Acts like spring?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will bounce the player when stomped.

layout.name: springForce10
layout.title: Force of spring
layout.tooltip: The height that the NPC launches the player, if set to be a spring.

layout.name: soundInterval10
layout.title: Interval between continuous sounds?
layout.tooltip: The delay before another sound plays.

layout.name: vine10
layout.title: Acts like vine?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will act as a climbable tile.

layout.name: coin10
layout.title: Acts like coin?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will become collectable.

layout.name: coinValue10
layout.title: Award how many coins?
layout.tooltip: How many coins the NPC is worth, if the above setting is selected.

layout.name: flipped10
layout.title: Can be flipped like a galoomba?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC can flip over when stomped or hit with a tail.

layout.name: generalEffect10
layout.title: Effect to spawn every so ticks?

layout.name: generalEffectX10
layout.title: Effect X Offset
layout.tooltip: Offsets the effect from the image, horizontally. Keep it 0 if you want it to be centred.

layout.name: generalEffectY10
layout.title: Effect Y Offset
layout.tooltip: Offsets the effect from the image, vertically. Keep it 0 if you want it to be centred.

layout.name: generalEffectRandomX10
layout.title: Amount of randomness X
layout.tooltip: The minimum X value of its range.

layout.name: generalEffectRandomY10
layout.title: Amount of randomness Y
layout.tooltip: The minimum Y value of its range.

layout.name: phaseWidth10
layout.title: Hitbox Width
layout.tooltip: The range of the NPC's hitbox, horizontally.

layout.name: phaseHeight10
layout.title: Hitbox Height
layout.tooltip: The range of the NPC's hitbox, vertically.

layout.name: phaseEffectSpeed10
layout.title: Effect Speed
layout.tooltip: X and Y speed of the spawned effect.

layout.name: phaseEffectOffsetX10
layout.title: Effect X Offset
layout.tooltip: Offsets the effect from the image, horizontally. Keep it 0 if you want it to be centred.

layout.name: phaseEffectOffsetY10
layout.title: Effect Y Offset
layout.tooltip: Offsets the effect from the image, vertically. Keep it 0 if you want it to be centred.

layout.name: zero
layout.text: Set to -1 to not affect current HP

layout.name: jumpTimerPhase10
layout.title: Set jump timer to
layout.tooltip: A timer that counts up. When it reaches the set number in ticks, the NPC will jump.

layout.name: stateTimedPhase10
layout.title: Set state timer to
layout.tooltip: A timer that counts up. When it reaches the set number in ticks, the NPC can enter a new phase.

layout.name: spawnTimerPhase10
layout.title: Set spawn timer to
layout.tooltip: A timer that counts up. When it reaches the set number in ticks, it will spawn the NPC.

layout.name: meleeTimerPhase10
layout.title: Set melee timer to
layout.tooltip: A timer that counts up. When it reaches the set number in ticks, it will attack with its melee hitbox.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
Stuff relating to Trailing NPCs.
Leave the first setting at 0 for no effect.

layout.name: trailNPCCount10
layout.title:
Number + ID of NPCs to spawn?
Separate each entry with a comma.

layout.name: trailX10
layout.title:
Distance, Diameter Offset, X Offset
Separate each entry with a comma.

layout.name: trailY10
layout.title:
Rotation Speed, Y Offset
Separate each entry with a comma.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
Waypoint related, leave the below setting
blank to ignore this chunk of settings.
If you want to display a specific animation when warping to a waypoint, use the fall animation settings.

layout.name: waypointXY10
layout.title: Offset from spawned point
layout.tooltip: Offset the waypoint from its current position. This runs AFTER the NPC has reached it.

layout.name: waypointExactXY10
layout.title: Exact Coords to go to (leave at 0 to ignore)

layout.name: waypointStateTimer10
layout.title:
Allow state timer to
continue counting up?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC's state timer (the one that counts up every tick) will NOT be paused while the waypoint behaviour is running. Useful if you want to move the waypoint a bunch of places and have it end when the state timer reaches a desired integer.

layout.name: waypointTeleport10
layout.title: Move by teleporting?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will warp to the waypoint in a similar manner to a magikoopa.

layout.name: altAnimationTimer10
layout.title: Animation timer controlled by state timer?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC's state timer (the one that counts up every tick) will control the animation of the NPC, instead of the general timer usually used for animation.

layout.name: framesIdle10
layout.title: Animation frames
layout.tooltip: How many frames will play in a loop?

layout.name: framespeedIdle10
layout.title: Framespeed
layout.tooltip: How fast does the NPC cycle through each of its frames, measured by ticks. The lower the number, the less time before it switches to the next frame.

layout.name: frameoffsetIdle10
layout.title: Frame offset from the first in the image
layout.tooltip: Offset from frame 0, where the animation will start?

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
NOTE: Only applies if main framestyle
is set to 'Direction Independant'

layout.name: frameoffsetIdleRight10
layout.title: Frame offset facing right
layout.tooltip: Offset from frame 0, where the animation will start when facing right?

layout.name: framesWalk10
layout.title: Animation frames
layout.tooltip: How many frames will play in a loop?

layout.name: framespeedWalk10
layout.title: Framespeed
layout.tooltip: How fast does the NPC cycle through each of its frames, measured by ticks. The lower the number, the less time before it switches to the next frame.

layout.name: frameoffsetWalk10
layout.title: Frame offset from the first in the image
layout.tooltip: Offset from frame 0, where the animation will start?

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
NOTE: Only applies if main framestyle
is set to 'Direction Independant'

layout.name: frameoffsetWalkRight10
layout.title: Frame offset facing right
layout.tooltip: Offset from frame 0, where the animation will start when facing right?

layout.name: framesJump10
layout.title: Animation frames

layout.tooltip: Offset from frame 0, where the animation will start?

NOTE: Only applies if main framestyle

layout.title: Frame offset facing right
layout.tooltip: Offset from frame 0, where the animation will start when facing right?

layout.name: zero

layout.name: maxHP10
layout.title: HP
layout.tooltip: The HP of the NPC in its first phase. If HP is set to 0, the NPC cannot die.

layout.name: hpdamagefire10
layout.title: Damage from fireballs
layout.tooltip: The amount of damage the NPC takes when hit by a fireball.

layout.name: hpdamagefireSFX10
layout.title: Sound effect when hit by fireball

layout.name: hpdamage10
layout.title: Damage from anything else
layout.tooltip: The amount of damage the NPC takes when hit otherwise.

layout.name: hpdamageSFX10
layout.title: Sound effect when hit by anything else

layout.name: paralyse10
layout.title: Paralysed from jumps?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will stop moving when jumped on.

layout.name: paralyseAnything10
layout.title: Paralysed from anything?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will stop moving when attacked

layout.name: knockback10
layout.title: Player knockback from jumps
layout.tooltip: How far the player is launched when jumping on the NPC.

layout.name: rotationSpeed10
layout.title: Rotation Speed
layout.tooltip: The speed in which the NPC rotates. Recommended to set it the same as its current speed.

layout.name: speedAdjust10
layout.title:
Adjust current speed based on
previous state's speed?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will gradually change its current speed based on the speed from the last state.

layout.name: shake10
layout.title: Shakes?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will shake as if it's been harmed.

layout.name: redirector10
layout.title: Moves with redirectors?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will react to redirectors. They can change its movement speed. Speed is determined by horizontal movement speed.

layout.name: lineGuide10
layout.title: Moves with line guides?
layout.tooltip: If true, the NPC will follow line guides. Speed is determined by horizontal movement speed.

layout.name: generalTimerX10
layout.title: General Timer (hover over me!)
layout.tooltip:
Controls a multitude of things relating to the above setting.
It affects the time it stays still when wandering, the slipperiness of it when chasing, the time before it turns around if set as a SMW enemy and how far it moves before changing speed if set to be a hammer bro. Alongside this, it also affects the jumping delay for the 'Zelda 2 Bot' general movement option.
Keep at -1 to not have this come into play.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The next three options must have
The next checkbox be ticked.

layout.name: horizAmplitude10
layout.title: Horizontal Sine Amplitude
layout.tooltip: Adjusts how far the NPC moves, before turning. <u>Recommended to keep roughly between 1 and 150.</u>

layout.name: generalTimerY10
layout.title: General Timer (hover over me!)
layout.tooltip:
Controls a multitude of things relating to the above setting.
It affects the slipperiness of it when chasing and the time before it turns around if set as a SMW enemy.
Keep at -1 to not have this come into play.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The next three options must have
The next checkbox be ticked.

layout.name: vertiAmplitude10
layout.title: Vertical Sine Amplitude
layout.tooltip: Adjusts how far the NPC moves, before turning. <u>Recommended to keep roughly between 1 and 150.</u>

layout.name: zero
layout.text: Set the below setting to -1 to have it not jump.

layout.name: jumpTimer10
layout.title: Jump Timer
layout.tooltip: A timer that counts up. When it reaches the set number in ticks, the NPC will jump.

layout.name: jumpHeight10
layout.title: Jump Height
layout.tooltip: Jumping height of the NPC.

layout.name: jumpAir10
layout.title: Can jump in air?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC doesn't need to be touching the ground in order to jump.

layout.name: playerJump10
layout.title: Jumps when player jumps?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will jump when the player does.

layout.name: paragoombaJump10
layout.title: Jumps like a paragoomba?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will jump twice, then perform a jump based on the other settings.

layout.name: stun10
layout.title: Stun player when landing?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will stun the player when landing, if they are on the ground.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
Define spawn settings in the
Spawning Settings category.

layout.name: jumpSpawn10
layout.title: Can spawn NPCs when jumping?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC spawns another when jumping. Must be defined below.

layout.name: zero
layout.text: Set the below setting to -1 to have it not spawn anything.

layout.name: spawnTimer10
layout.title: Spawn Timer
layout.tooltip: A timer that counts up. When it reaches the set number in ticks, it will spawn the NPC.

layout.name: spawnedNPC10
layout.title: NPC to spawn
layout.tooltip: Optional NPC to spawn. Leave blank to not spawn anything.

layout.name: burst10
layout.title: Number of shots
layout.tooltip: Fires NPCs in a burst.

layout.name: alterX10
layout.title: Alter x-position by how much
layout.tooltip: Bigger numbers give more intense effects.

layout.name: alterY10
layout.title: Alter y-position by how much
layout.tooltip: Bigger numbers give more intense effects.

layout.name: spawnX10
layout.title: Spawn X Offset
layout.tooltip: X offset to spawn, offset from the NPC's centre.

layout.name: spawnY10
layout.title: Spawn Y Offset
layout.tooltip: Y offset to spawn, offset from the NPC's centre.

layout.name: targetX10
layout.title: Targets player's X-coords?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will target the player on the X-axis.

layout.name: targetY10
layout.title: Targets player's Y-coords?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will target the player on the Y-axis.

layout.name: spawnSpeedX10
layout.title: Spawn Speed X
layout.tooltip: X speed of the spawned NPC.

layout.name: spawnSpeedY10
layout.title: Spawn Speed Y
layout.tooltip: Y speed of the spawned NPC.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
The below setting lets the other two become available.
The number input determines the minimum range
of speed it can start from. So if you have its X speed
set at 5, and put the amount of randomness at 2,
it will choose a speed between 2 and 5. -5 will make it
have a range between -5 and 5, so in front and behind.

layout.name: randomCheck10
layout.title: Random Movement?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the below settings will become available.

layout.name: randomSpeedX10
layout.title: Amount of randomness X
layout.tooltip: The minimum X value of its range, in terms of speed.

layout.name: randomSpeedY10
layout.title: Amount of randomness Y
layout.tooltip: The minimum Y value of its range, in terms of speed.

layout.name: spawnAI10
layout.title:
NPC's AI fields
(each number represents ai1-ai6)

layout.name: deathParent10
layout.title:
Dies when parent dies?
(Or changes states)

layout.name: meleeTimer10
layout.title: Timer before attacking
layout.tooltip: A timer that counts up. When it reaches the set number in ticks, it will attack with its melee hitbox.

layout.name: meleeX10
layout.title: X offset of the hitbox
layout.tooltip: The X offset from the centre of the NPC.

layout.name: meleeY10
layout.title: Y offset of the hitbox
layout.tooltip: The Y offset from the centre of the NPC.

layout.name: meleeTime10
layout.title: Attack duration
layout.tooltip: The time in ticks that the NPC attacks for. Each second is 64 ticks.

layout.name: meleePlayer10
layout.title: Harms players?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the hitbox will be dangerous to players.

layout.name: meleeNPC10
layout.title: Harms NPCs?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the hitbox will be deadly to most hittable NPCs.

layout.name: meleeBlock10
layout.title: Breaks Blocks?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the hitbox will be devastating to fragile blocks.

layout.name: meleeSpeed10
layout.title: Set speed to 0?
layout.tooltip: If checked, the NPC will stop to attack.

layout.name: meleePhase10
layout.title:
Change phase when a player
enters the hitbox.

layout.name: meleeDebug10
layout.title: Display visual of hitbox?
layout.tooltip: Set this to see where the hitbox will be. Recommended for debugging purposes.

layout.name: phaseChangeWall10
layout.title: Change phases to...
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into.

layout.name: up10
layout.title: Change phases to...
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into.

layout.name: air10
layout.title: Change phases to...
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into.

layout.name: down10
layout.title: Change phases to...
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into.

layout.name: upTrigger10
layout.title: Transform if the player is above the NPC?

layout.name: downTrigger10
layout.title: Transform if the player is below the NPC?

layout.name: noHP10
layout.title: Transform when lost all HP?
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into. The NPC will regain all HP and transform. Useful for simulating boss phases.

layout.name: jump10
layout.title: Transform when jumped on (or stood on)
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into.

layout.name: grab10
layout.title: Transform when grabbed
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into.

layout.name: below10
layout.title: Transform when hit from below
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into.

layout.name: hitNPC10
layout.title: Transform when hit with NPC
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into.

layout.name: hitProjectile10
layout.title:
Transform when hit by
NPC as a projectile
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into.

layout.name: lava10
layout.title: Transform when fallen into lava
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into.

layout.name: held10
layout.title: Transform when killed by being held
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into.

layout.name: tail10
layout.title: Transform when tail swiped
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into.

layout.name: offscreen10
layout.title: Transform when killed by offscreen
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into.

layout.name: sword10
layout.title: Transform when stabbed
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into.

layout.name: zero
layout.text: Set the below settings to 0 to not transform.

layout.name: approachState10
layout.title: Transform when approached
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into. Only works if the above value is not set to 0.

layout.name: leaveNPCState10
layout.title: Transform when approached
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into. Only works if the above value is not set to 0.

layout.name: collidePlayerState10
layout.title: Transform when colliding with player
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into. Only works if the above value is not set to 0.

layout.name: collideNPCState10
layout.title: Transform when colliding with npcs
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into. Only works if the above value is not set to 0.

layout.name: collideNPCStateIDs10
layout.title: Specific NPCs to transform on
layout.tooltip: Input any NPC ID you want to be able to transform on when colliding.

layout.name: inWaterState10
layout.title: Transform when entering water
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into. Only works if the above value is not set to 0.

layout.name: outWaterState10
layout.title: Transform when exiting water
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into. Only works if the above value is not set to 0.

layout.name: facingLeft10
layout.title: Transform when facing player
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into. Only works if the above value is not set to 0.

layout.name: facingRight10
layout.title: Transform when not facing player
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into. Only works if the above value is not set to 0.

layout.name: zero
layout.text:
Set the below settings to -1 to not transform.
This is an internal timer that counts up, and when it
hits the set number it will transform.
Additionally, you can use an event to transform as well.

layout.name: stateTimedState10
layout.title: Transform to...
layout.tooltip:
Input a number from 1-10. These represent a
new phase that the NPC can transform into. Only works if the above value is not set to 0.
